From precision-engineered buckets and skids to intricately crafted cabins and chassis, our expertise extends across a diverse range of products. Our state-of-the-art facilities feature advanced equipment, including automatic robotic welding, CNC laser-guided machinery, cutting-edge saw welding machines, and plasma lasers. This technological prowess empowers us to deliver projects with unmatched precision, adhering to stringent industry norms. Recognized by the Research Designs and Standards Organization (RDSO), Pranjal Projects stands as a trusted name in railway and bridge construction. Our reputation is built on the pillars of timely project delivery, customer satisfaction, and an unwavering commitment to quality. Our Excavator Division delivers a comprehensive range of attachments, meticulously designed and manufactured for reliability and peak performance in demanding work environments. Our distinguishing strengths include: Advanced Design & Engineering: Utilizing sophisticated CAD/CAM and FEA, our expert team engineers attachments for optimal structural integrity and extended service life. This ensures robust performance under extreme conditions. Precision Manufacturing: Our Faridabad facility employs advanced machinery and skilled technicians to achieve superior fitment and construction. Every step, from material selection to welding, adheres to stringent quality control, minimizing wear and maximizing durability. Intelligent Weight Optimization: We strategically optimize weight in our designs. This balance of strength and reduced mass improves fuel economy, increases lifting capacity, and minimizes strain on your equipment. We offer a diverse array of bucket types, including standard digging, heavy-duty rock, trenching, skeleton/riddle, and other specialized designs, ensuring the precise tool for every application. It is a fabrication driven engineering case study. The project demanded far more than scale. It required absolute control over geometry, tolerances, sequencing, and integration while preserving architectural expression through exposed steel and composite systems. What defined the complexity: â€¢ Architecturally expressive, exposed composite steel structure â€¢ Diagonal grid systems, radial beams, and curvilinear box girders â€¢ Large-diameter hollow steel columns working with a central RCC core â€¢ Cantilevered members and circumferential steel elements â€¢ Alternate hinge and fixed joint strategy to balance expression and performance How it was engineered and fabricated: â€¢ Entire structure digitally resolved in Tekla Structures before fabrication â€¢ Fabrication drawings issued with coordinate control for every steel member â€¢ Tight tolerance fabrication to manage complex geometry and curved profiles â€¢ Pre-engineered sleeves and openings for seamless MEP integration â€¢ Composite floors using steel decking to accelerate construction timelines How execution was controlled on site: â€¢ Total Station mapping used to transfer digital coordinates to physical erection â€¢ Member-by-member verification to ensure millimetrelevel accuracy â€¢ Fabrication and erection sequencing planned to protect alignment and stability â€¢ Fire performance and durability addressed at the fabrication stage itself The attached document captures how fabrication thinking, not site correction, enables complex composite buildings to be delivered efficiently, accurately, and at architectural scale.
